data.title: Kalkaji Mandir Timings
data.meta_description: Kalkaji Mandir in Delhi Explore Kalkaji Mandir History, How to Reach Kalkaji Mandir Timings, Latest Photos Aarti darshan Best Time to Visit
data.text:
About Kalkaji Mandir

Kalkaji Mandir in Delhi is dedicated to Kalka Devi, a form of Durga Mata. The temple is also known as Jayanti Peeth and Manokamna Siddha Peet. It is believed this was a very ancient place of worship going back to the days when Durga Mata killed the demon Raktabeej. The Murti enshrined here is a Swayambhu (Self Appeared) Murti. Check, Latest Kalkaji Mandir Timings

The present temple was first constructed by the Marathas in 1746 CE.

Shri Krishna and the Pandavas

This is the place where Kalika Mata blessed the Devas who had prayed to Her. It is believed Shri Krishna Himself and the Pandavas have worshipped at this temple during the Mahabharata era.

Click Here Kalkaji Mandir E-Pass Booking

Kalkaji Mandir Timings

04:00 AM to 11:30 PM

Temple Puja and Aarti timings

(Note: Temple remains closed-form 03:00 PM to 04:00 PM for cleaning and from 11:30 PM to 04:00 AM)

How to reach Kalkaji Mandir

New Delhi Railway Station is about 14 km from the temple.

Nizamuddin Railway station is about 7.5 km from the temple.

Delhi Airport is about 16 km from the temple.

The nearest metro station is the Kalkaji Mandir Metro Station just 100 meters from the temple.

Places to visit in Delhi

Pragati Maidan

India Gate

Akshardham Temple

Lotus temple

Birla Mandir

Red Fort

Qutub Minar
